author: amareshbAtMicrosoft
body:
Steps to reproduce
------------------
1. Connect to remote Powershell session on a different computer using new-PsSession.
2. Run some cmdlets in the above session (using PowerShell implicit remoting)
3. Now Restart the remote PS service
4. Now try running new cmdlet, it throws a windows popup for credentials.

Expected behavior
-----------------
Given in our scenario, the credentials are oAuth tokens, they cant be entered by the user. Instead we need a handle/callback that our can provide the UI and ultimately return the credentials.

Actual behavior
---------------
Given user doesn't know what to do with the popup for creds, users is forced to close the session and start afresh.

Environment data
----------------
title: Add a callback API to support a way to pass in credentials rather than prompting
